ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Calculate model flux or count rate

DESC.PARA: Convert between energy flux, photon flux and count rate for any Sherpa model, given a set of spectral response files. The method assumes the model has an overall linear normalization.

SYNTAX.LINE: modelflux arf="arf.fits" rmf="rmf.fits" model="xsphabs.abs1*powlaw1d.p1" paramvals="abs1.nh=0.07;p1.gamma=2.26" emin="0.5" emax="7.0"

DESC.PARA: The default use is to convert from rate to flux. This example calculates the flux of the source in [0.5,7.0] keV corresponding to a count rate of 1 count/second in the same band.

SYNTAX.LINE: modelflux arf="arf.fits" rmf="rmf.fits" model="xsphabs.abs1*powlaw1d.p1" paramvals="abs1.nh=0.07;p1.gamma=2.26;p1.ampl=0.0003" emin="0.5" emax="7.0" rate="0.1"

DESC.PARA: Here we specify an explicit count rate of 0.1 count/s and calculate the energy flux and photon flux that would generate that count rate, given the model.
Even though we specified an amplitude parameter for the power law, it does not affect the result, since the output is linearly rescaled to match the requested count rate.

SYNTAX.LINE: modelflux arf="arf.fits" rmf="rmf.fits" model="xsphabs.abs1*powlaw1d.p1" paramvals="abs1.nh=0.07;p1.gamma=2.26;p1.ampl=0.0003" emin="0.1" emax="10.0" oemin="0.5" oemax="2.0" rate="0.1"

DESC.PARA: This example finds out what flux in the energy range 0.1-10 keV would produce a 0.5-2 keV count rate of 0.1 count/s. The emin and emax parameters always specify the energy range for the flux; the oemin and oemax parameters can be used to specify a different energy band for the rate.

SYNTAX.LINE: modelflux arf="arf.fits" rmf="rmf.fits" model="xsphabs.abs1*(powlaw1d.p1+xsgaussian.g)" paramvals="abs1.nh=0.07;p1.gamma=2.26;p1.ampl=0.0003;g.sigma=0.1;g.line=1.0;g.norm=1.0e-5" emin="0.5" emax="2.0" flux="1.E-12" opt="flux"

DESC.PARA: This example uses "opt=flux" to tell modelflux we are giving it the flux and want to know the count rate (opt="rate" is the default). Calculates the count rate of the source in [0.5,2.0] keV where a flux of 1E-12 ergs/cm^2/s is observed in the same band. Although the overall normalization is scaled to the requested flux, the relative normalizations of the two components are set using the p1.ampl and g.norm parameters.

PARAM.name: model
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: Sherpa model definition string, e.g. xsphabs.abs1*xspowerlaw.p1

PARAM.name: paramvals
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: semicolon-delimited (';') string of (id.parameter=value) pairs, e.g. abs1.nh=0.07;p1.gamma=2.26

PARAM.name: emin
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: Lower bound of flux energy range in keV

PARAM.name: emax
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: Upper bound of flux energy range in keV

PARAM.name: oemin
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: Lower bound of energy range for count rate in keV, default=emin

PARAM.name: oemax
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: Upper bound of energy range for count rate in keV, default=emin

PARAM.name: pflux
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: photon flux in energy range in photon cm^-2 s^-1

PARAM.name: flux
PARAM.SYNOPSIS: energy flux in energy range in erg cm^-2 s^-1

DESC.PARA: This parameter is used to control whether modelflux calculates a rate from the flux or pflux parameters, or vice versa.
